frame.name: Resurrection
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Protagonist</fen> which had been dead returns to life.
<ex><fex name="pro">He</fex>'ll <t>come</t> <t>back</t> <fex name="pri">from the dead</fex> <fex name="tim">at 11:03PM exactly</fex>, <fex name="rea">since that's what his suicide note indicated</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Protagonist
FE.definition:
<def-root>The being or entity that becomes living again.
<ex>If <fex name="pro">the Lord</fex> <t>resurrected</t> in three days, surely he could relieve my back pain in, say, a week.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the resurrection occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>An explanation of how the state-of-affairs came to pass.</def-root>

FE.name: Prior_state
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state of the <fen>Protagonist</fen> before resurrection.
<ex>If he <t>comes</t> <t>back</t> <fex name="pri">from the dead</fex>, we'll need this spell to ward him off.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state of the <fen>Protagonist</fen> which results from resurrection.
<ex>I just hope he doesn't <t>come</t> <t>back</t> <fex name="res">to life</fex> again.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state of the <fen>Protagonist</fen> during the resurrection.
<ex>The trouble is they always <t>come</t> <t>back</t> to life <fex name="dep">angry</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location at which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> returns from the dead.</def-root>
